title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:05 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
00:18 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki

07:07 <nuvolari> Hi guys/gals, what do you prefer to use for CI?  
07:07 <+cjdelisle> We are using jenkins now, I suppose it depends on your needs.

07:38 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:17 <vmassol> has quit  
08:40 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:42 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki

10:02 <nuvolari> vmassol: mornings. What do you use for CI?  
10:02 <vmassol> nuvolari: jenkins  
10:15 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:27 <+tmortagne> vmassol: it's still teamcity in the image on the top of the http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/ContinuousBuild page ;)  
10:27 <vmassol> I know  
10:27 <vmassol> we need to fix the image  
10:27 <+tmortagne> you do'nt have the source anymore ?  
10:28 <vmassol> I can redo it with omnigrafle  
10:28 <vmassol> it was done on powerpoint initially  
10:28 <+tmortagne> ok  
10:28 <+tmortagne> actually it's not only teamcity issue :)  
10:30 <vmassol> yp  
10:30 <vmassol> I want to finish the macro archetype first  
10:33 <vmassol> trying to find a way to pass project.version to the archetype's pom.xml  
10:54 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
10:57 <jbrBridge> [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] I just migrated to 2.7.1 with the goal of a functional pdf export.  
10:57 <jbrBridge> [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] Using this (public) url: https://www.computer42.org/xwiki/bin/export/DevNotes/WebHome?format=pdf&includelinks=9&pagebreaks=1&includechilds=9  
10:57 <jbrBridge> [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] I'm getting this error:  
10:57 <jbrBridge> [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)]     Error number 11015 in 11: Exception while exporting  
10:57 <jbrBridge> [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] Wrapped Exception: Error number 12002 in 12: Exception while exporting PDF  
10:57 <jbrBridge> [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] Wrapped Exception: org.apache.fop.fo.ValidationException: "fo:list-block" is missing child elements. Required content model: marker\* (list-item)+ (See position 5894:90)  
10:57 <jbrBridge> [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] com.xpn.xwiki.XWikiException: Error number 11015 in 11: Exception while exporting  
10:59 <+tmortagne> looks like searching "org.apache.fop.fo.ValidationException: "fo:list-block" is missing child elements" on google is a good way to find XWiki based websites (where google robot tried to export in pdf)  
11:06 <jbrBridge> [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] tmortagne: o.k. - a new bug ?  
11:07 <+tmortagne> [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection): sorry not a pdf export expert  
11:07 <+tmortagne> sdumutriu could help you but he's not connected right now, try on user mailing list maybe  
11:08 <+mflorea> lucaa and jvelociter: please take the time to write some words about the features you've implemented for 3.0M2 . See your TODOs on http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise30M3  
11:08 <jvelociter> mflorea: yep will do  
11:08 <+lucaa> mflorea: it's on my todo list  
11:09 <+mflorea> great, thanks both of you  
11:21 <jstoldt|Notebook> morning  
11:21 <jstoldt|Notebook> isn't the child parameter only supposed to take numbers from 1 to 6  
11:21 <jstoldt|Notebook> same for includelinks?  
11:21 <rrodriguez> has quit  
11:28 <+sburjan> hello. @devs: I am allowed to annotate content on the Activity Stream and on LiveTables. IMO we shouldn't allow this, especially on LiveTables. WDYT ?  
11:33 <+lucaa> why? I worked a lot to make the annotations work on annotating everything  
11:33 <+lucaa> well, there are still limitations (html macro) but that's the direction  
11:36 <+lucaa> that's not the argument to allow it, of course, but I am curious why we shouldn't  
11:36 <vmassol> tmortagne: htmlcleaner is published in the central repo now apparenrtly: http://htmlcleaner.sourceforge.net/  
11:36 <+sburjan> LiveTable content is generated dynamically. when you annotate a LiveTable result, what do you annotate more exactly ?  
11:36 <+lucaa> you annotate what you see  
11:37 <+lucaa> that's the whole idea  
11:37 <+lucaa> as long as you can see it, you can annotate it  
11:37 <+lucaa> when you won't see it anymore, you won't see the annotation anymore on the content, but you can still see it in the list of annotations on the page  
11:38 <+sburjan> on what page if the content is dynamically created by the LiveTable ?  
11:38 <+lucaa> I mean really, the whole idea in the beginning was to be able to annotate content generated dinamically  
11:38 <+lucaa> on the page in which you see it :)  
11:38 <+sburjan> ok, you know better  
11:38 <+lucaa> I don't, I want to know how it's perceived  
11:39 <+lucaa> I mean, if we don't allow annotations on dinamically generated content, would we allow it on a velocity macro, for example?  
11:39 <+tmortagne> vmassol: yes that's what is in my patch on http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XRENDERING-46 but i could not finish it  
11:39 <+lucaa> on content generated by a velocity macro  
11:39 <vmassol> tmortagne: ok  
11:40 <+sburjan> doesn't make much sense to me to annotat econtent of LiveTables. And annotations on AS don't work. Same issue we have on blog. You annotate, but the annotation small yellow button is at the bottom  
11:42 <+sburjan> I guess I should make an issue for that (lie we have for Blog)  
11:42 <+sburjan> \*like  
11:43 <+sburjan> also I am allowed to Annotate Search results, but I can't see the annotation because I don't have the annotations tab  
11:44 <+sburjan> nor any other tab on that page  
11:48 <+sburjan> devs, WDYT ?  
11:48 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
11:48 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:49 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:51 <vmassol> sburjan: I do'nt see the problem  
11:51 <vmassol> it's a nice feature to me  
11:51 <vmassol> (being allowed to annotate everyhing)  
11:51 <vmassol> that it doesn't work on some stuff is a bug yes  
11:53 <+sburjan> vmassol: yes, but they don't work. If I annotate WebHome on a LiveTable in which I have other 7 WebHome pages, annotation will be visible in the Annotations Tab, but \_not\_ on content  
11:54 <+lucaa> sburjan: that must be the greatest coolest html macro ;)  
11:54 <+lucaa> whcih annotations don't handle, YET  
11:54 <+lucaa> (I need to get some internet at home...)  
11:55 <+sburjan> anso, Annotations on search Page results is useless... I don't have even the tabs there :)  
11:55 <+sburjan> I am +1 for Annotations in AS, but they don't work .. I'll report the bug on XE/AS App  
11:55 <vmassol> yes annos on dynamic content is weird  
11:55 <+lucaa> the pb is not that webhome appears several times, that should be handled. Worst case the first occurrence of the webhome will be displayed  
11:55 <vmassol> lucaa: do we have an exsiting easy way to disable annotations on a given page?  
11:56 <+lucaa> not on page, but on space  
11:56 <+sburjan> lucaa: yes, but my problem is that after annotating a WebHome result, I don't know which is the annoteted one.. for example after a refresh, etc  
11:57 <+sburjan> I see it in the tab, but no yellow icon next to the annotated text  
11:58 <+sburjan> I understand it's a great future, not trying to block it or something. it's just that there are places where it's unusable (Search Results page), and places where it would be useful but doesn't work (Blog, AS)  
11:59 <+sburjan> IMO a mechanism to blog annos at a page level would allow more flexibility (just a suggestion)  
11:59 <+sburjan> \*block  
11:59 <+sburjan> and yes, harder to implement  
12:02 <+lucaa> no, it's not  
12:02 <+sburjan> IMO the best and safest strategy is to block something where it has no point instead of letting users users add it. Generates mess, which is harder to remove (impossible from UI)  
12:02 <+lucaa> it's not harder to implement  
12:03 <+lucaa> what's impossible to remove?  
12:03 <+sburjan> lucaa: you know better :) I would be cool when editing a page to have a checkbox (wiki and WYSIWYG) ... "Allow annotations on this page"  
12:03 <+lucaa> you can remove all annotations, from the tab!  
12:03 <+lucaa> one by one, yes (unfo) but so are comments  
12:03 <+sburjan> If I annotate a result from Search Page, how can I remove it ? (I am a normal user, not a dev)  
12:03 <+lucaa> go to the annotations tab  
12:03 <+lucaa> and there!  
12:03 <+sburjan> I don't have tabs on that page  
12:03 <+lucaa> right  
12:04 <+lucaa> I didn't know that  
12:04 <+sburjan> I don't have any tab on that page  
12:04 <+sburjan> I know, it's small, minor, but IMO it's inconsistent to be allowed to add annotation on that page  
12:04 <+lucaa> so maybe maybe, in the same way we disable comments, attachments et all (by hiding the UI) we should disable annotations  
12:05 <+sburjan> on some pages we could "hardcode" this .. eg. Search Results. On normal pages, we could allow user to checkbox if it allows annotations. Because hiding the tab won't block ctrl+m action  
12:06 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
12:06 <+lucaa> sburjan: no, we cannot hardcode anything ;)  
12:06 <+lucaa> the way I see it, the problem is like this  
12:07 <+sburjan> just wanted to suggest to force a certain level of consistency on some pages that by their purpose don't need annotations  
12:07 <+lucaa> comments on search page don't make sense, in the same way in which annotations on search page don't make sense  
12:07 <+sburjan> yes  
12:07 <+sburjan> also attachments :)  
12:07 <+lucaa> now, for the comments we hacked fix it: hide the UI and there, it's fixed  
12:07 <+lucaa> but this is not a fix  
12:07 <+sburjan> but I am still allowed to annotate, and I guess an object is save in the page  
12:07 <+sburjan> \*saved  
12:07 <+lucaa> since there is no way the annotations module could query this metadata of the page, so that I know that they should not be there  
12:08 <+sburjan> I understand  
12:09 <+lucaa> this is metadata of the page (comments don't make sense), which is not stored anywhere  
12:09 <+sburjan> so it's pretty impossible to achieve what I am saying  
12:09 <+lucaa> it's just the UI is hidden  
12:09 <+lucaa> "everything is possible, we just need to find out how"  
12:09 <+lucaa> I'm not saying it's not possible  
12:09 <+sburjan> yes, but with annos is a bit complicated, hiding the tab won't block users from annotating  
12:09 <+lucaa> exactly  
12:09 <+sburjan> I understand you POV :)  
12:09 <+lucaa> so, what I'm saying, is that we need to fix the way this metadata is stored  
12:09 <+lucaa> so that you can actually query it as metadata  
12:09 <+lucaa> or add a super velocity variable to disable annotations, or something, in the same way in which we have super velocity variables to hide tabs  
12:10 <+lucaa> (and therefore "disable" those features)  
12:10 <+sburjan> yes, we have multiple choices ..  
12:26 <+mflorea> vmassol: I think you missed my message from yesterday evening: should we add/keep links to Commons/Rendering javadoc on  http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/API ? Or should we put  this information in their wikis? I'm more in favor of having the  javadoc links in one place.  
12:27 <+mflorea> btw, the link to the rendering javadoc is broken right now. I can fix it but we need to decide if we list all javadocs on DevGuide.API or just for the XWiki API  
12:29 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
13:05 <Enygma`1> has joined #xwiki  
13:05 <evalica1> has joined #xwiki  
13:06 <evalica> has quit  
13:06 <Enygma`> has quit  
13:06 <sburjan> has quit  
13:09 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
13:09 <@sdumitriu> jvelociter: doc.web is deprecated in lucene as well, use doc.space  
13:19 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
13:21 <vmassol> mflorea: I 've seen it  
13:21 <vmassol> my pov is  
13:21 <vmassol> have it in 2 locations  
13:21 <vmassol> I think it's needed to have it in the project's itself  
13:22 <vmassol> in the future if we show more our projects as forge projects then I think users could expect to go to that project's page to get the info  
13:22 <vmassol> for  now it's ok to also aggregate the info on aggregation pages  
13:22 <vmassol> for javadoc, documentation, etc  
13:22 <vmassol> for ex I added rendering here: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/ProductDocumentation  
13:23 <vmassol> I'm going to work today on adding doc to rendering.xwiki.org  
13:23 <+mflorea> I'm worried that the info will be too spread  
13:23 <vmassol> well it's either you look by project  
13:24 <vmassol> or by tech  
13:24 <vmassol> both are valid ways of searching IMO  
13:24 <vmassol> and  
13:24 <vmassol> with xwiki we can have the best of both world with duplicating  
13:25 <vmassol> like tagging or adding an XObject to javadoc page for projects  
13:25 <vmassol> and then aggregating data automatically in a top level javadoc page  
13:25 <+mflorea> I see  
13:26 <+mflorea> right now the problem is that "platform" is not well defined and some users might search in the platform for the javadoc of commons and rendering  
13:26 <vmassol> yep  
13:26 <vmassol> it's ok to put in the doc of platform with a warning explanng the recent move  
13:26 <+mflorea> ok  
13:27 <vmassol> we need to work on this, as I said I'm going to improve rendering.xwiki.org today (hopefulyl)  
13:30 <jvelociter> sdumitriu: ok, will fix this  
13:44 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: "From what you can see in this chart, we have a huge pool of unassigned open issues."  
13:45 <@sdumitriu> This is how it should be  
13:45 <@sdumitriu> Hugging issues is a good way to repel possible contributors  
13:45 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: true :)  
13:50 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: Instead of project in (XPAS, XAADMINISTRATION, XPADWORDS,... you can use  
13:50 <@sdumitriu> category in ("XWiki.org Top Level Projects", "XWiki Commons", "XWiki Platform Build Tools", "XWiki Platform Plugins, Applications & Skins")  
13:51 <+sburjan> on the clients recommended versions ?  
13:53 <@sdumitriu> ?  
13:53 <@sdumitriu> In jira queries  
13:53 <+sburjan> yes  
14:33 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
14:38 <jvelociter> has joined #xwiki  
14:39 <Denis> has quit  
14:49 <jvelociter> has quit  
14:51 <+sburjan> vmassol: why when accessingArchetypeCatalog I am asked to download a XML file ?  
14:51 <+sburjan> maven xml file  
14:52 <vmassol> because it's an xml file  
14:52 <vmassol> you don't need to access it though, it's a tech file  
14:52 <vmassol> you can read http://rendering.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/ExtendingMacro  
14:53 <vmassol> I wanted to have a short url but I could force passing xpage=plain and describe it if not passed this param....  
14:56 <+sburjan> I always wanted to see the definition of an archetype. :) But i guess this XML isn't the whole definition, because I see no specific project structure defined in it.  
14:56 <vmassol> it's a catalog  
14:56 <vmassol> yeah it simply lists existing archetypes  
14:56 <vmassol> for the def: http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/rendering/trunk/xwiki-rendering-archetype-macro/  
14:59 <+sburjan> thanks !  
15:05 <sburjan> has quit  
15:13 <vmassol> tmortagne: from a wiki page, can I ask the extension manager to give me the name of the last version of a given artifact? in the future I'd like to use it to generate the version used in http://rendering.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/edit/Main/ArchetypeCatalog?editor=wiki  
15:15 <+tmortagne> vmassol: extension manager can give you that for installed extension but i did not implemented this feature in the aether repository handler yet  
15:15 <+tmortagne> but you can do it directly with the aether API  
15:15 <+tmortagne> with some groovy  
15:16 <vmassol> cool, would need your help to do that… but we need to upgrade xwiki.org to 3.0 first I believe  
15:16 <vmassol> (so we need to wait a bit)  
15:16 <+tmortagne> yea I don't have much time right now  
15:17 <vmassol> sure  
15:17 <vmassol> there's no hurry and it needs 3.0 released anyway  
15:20 <+tmortagne> I would like to add that in extension manager at some point anyway but probably not high enough in the priority list to do that before you need it but using aether directly should not be that difficult  
15:29 <vmassol> tmortagne: yep  
15:32 <vmassol> mflorea: don't you think using jira ids in the release notes makes it too technical and less user-oriented? It's the first time we're doing this so I'm wondering  
15:33 <vmassol> it may be good I don't know…. just look a bit techie to me  
15:35 <+mflorea> vmassol: I agree, note that I didn't use too many JIRA ids (at least comparing to http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise271 ). Also note that I put JIRA ids before TODOs just as a reference for the dev that should fill in the description. They should be removed afterwards  
15:36 <+mflorea> I think we should keep them for the misc section because those are very specific issues  
15:36 <vmassol> mflorea: yes but fix is different MIO  
15:36 <vmassol> s/but fix/bugfix releases/  
15:36 <vmassol> s/MIO/IMO/  
15:37 <vmassol> I'll go over some of the misc things to beef them up too. I noticed one that I'd like to stand out more  
15:37 <+mflorea> sure. my idea was to add user friendly description for the big feaures/improvements introduced and list jira for the small ones. Again, the jira ids before TODOs are there only as a reference for the dev that need to write the description  
15:38 <+mflorea> ok, cool  
16:17 <jvelociter> has joined #xwiki  
17:01 <fmancinelli> Maybe you are already aware of this but... Do you know about CoffeeScript (http://jashkenas.github.com/coffee-script) ? Looks like a very interesting way for simplifying Javascript coding and protect coders from this language pitfalls  
17:02 <+jvelociter> where's the DOM ?  
17:02 <+jvelociter> :)  
17:02 <+jvelociter> I think it's meant to be used for server side scripting  
17:02 <+jvelociter> node.js in particular  
17:04 <fmancinelli> jvelociter: AFAIU no. It supports everything works with Javascript, even clientside (e.g., JQuery & Co.)  
17:05 <+jvelociter> yes, but I don't think it's been build with client side in mind  
17:06 <fmancinelli> jvelociter: why not?  
17:07 <+jvelociter> also in my opinion it complexifies the dev cycle  
17:08 <+jvelociter> since you have to run the transformer each time you change the slightest line  
17:08 <fmancinelli> true  
17:08 <+jvelociter> fmancinelli: there is no example of DOM manipulation in their examples  
17:09 <fmancinelli> jvelociter: don't see where the problem is... afterall the DOM is exposed as JS object. Btw there are JQuery specific examples  
17:10 <+jvelociter> yep found  
17:10 <+jvelociter> ok, but still I don't find this approach very agile for doing web development  
17:11 <+jvelociter> the only advantage I see it brings is safer operators  
17:11 <+jvelociter> IMO does not worth the cost of precompling  
17:12 <fmancinelli> jvelociter: the language looks very nice compared to JS... I would rather learn CoffeScript than JavaScript :)  
17:13 <+jvelociter> sure but that does not make it more adapted for what we are doing, that's all I'm saying:)  
17:17 <+jvelociter> (same reason I find that GWT was not adapted to do XWiki Watch)  
17:17 <@sdumitriu> Well, VisualBasic is simple as well, but that's not relevant  
17:18 <@sdumitriu> The problem with using a meta-code framework is that you depend on the framework  
17:18 <@sdumitriu> If CoffeeScript disappears, we'll be stuck with a bunch of code that doesn't evolve anymore  
17:18 <@sdumitriu> JS is simple  
17:21 <+jvelociter> sdumitriu: well you could then generate your JS once and for all and work on the generated codebase ... ^^  
17:21 <@sdumitriu> Yeah, you try editing GWT-generated code...  
17:39 <fmancinelli> not sure that the disappearing of coffeescript would be such a big problem for the ones who adopt it... anyway I was not pushing for anything. I've just found cofeescript very interesting and I was willing to share this thought :)  
17:56 <+jvelociter> hmm I have JSX all screwed on my local instance I don't understand why  
17:57 <+jvelociter> looks like the minification fails or something  
17:57 <vmassol> I wonder if we're going to be hit:  
17:57 <vmassol> "Looks like #google #gwt also has issues for #mac developers with the latest #java update from #apple bit.ly/hurosj"  
17:57 <+jvelociter> it inserts a lot of "gets" at some points in the generated file  
17:57 <+jvelociter> A.Activity=Class.create({initialize:function(){this.initHandlers()}get ,initHandlers:function()  
17:57 <vmassol> http://code.google.com/p/google-web-toolkit/issues/detail?id=6125  
17:57 <vmassol> we're on gwt 2.1 right?  
17:57 <+jvelociter> vmassol: Marius does not have a Mac, so we are safe;)  
17:58 <vmassol> no you mean he's fine  
17:58 <vmassol> but we're not  
17:58 <vmassol> :)  
17:58 <vmassol> "When running a GWT app: The web application server starts up, but immediately crashes after the GWT app is started"  
17:58 <+jvelociter> yes but personnaly I never build the wisywyg  
17:58 <vmassol> it's at runtime apparenrtly  
17:58 <+jvelociter> ahhh it's at runtime  
17:58 <+jvelociter> that's bad  
17:58 <vmassol> I'll try it  
17:58 <+jvelociter> !  
17:58 <vmassol> since I've upgraded my java version  
18:02 <+jvelociter> sdumitriu: I'm thinking about XAANNOTATIONS-40  
18:02 <+jvelociter> not a big fan of firing dom:loaded again  
18:02 <+jvelociter> also, I'd like to try having annotations loaded by default
